intro: Cadetia karoensis, commonly known as the Karo mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes in Ecuador. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and often branched. Cadetia karoensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens for its unique floral display.
